instructions.name: Blend the milk, yogurt (plain or vanilla), vanilla extract, mango, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth and creamy.
Combine all ingredients in the nutribullet; fill with water to the "Max" line. Mix until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in the nutribullet; fill with water to the "Max" line. Mix until smooth. Enjoy!
Prepare vegetables and send through the juicer. Strain if desired. Mix well before drinking. Enjoy!
Use frozen strawberries and a frozen banana for a colder shake. Alternatively, add 6 or more ice cubes.
In a blender, blend the milk, yogurt, banana, protein supplement, flax seed, honey, and strawberries until smooth.
Just put all the ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Optionally, blend with ice. Then drink and enjoy!
Place all the ingredients in a blender, and mix until smooth. Enjoy immediately.
Mix all ingredients, add 6 ice cubes, and blend for 30 seconds.
Blend spinach and coconut water until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add more water to achieve desired consistency. Enjoy!
Blend spinach and coconut water until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients, and blend until smooth.
Cut the cucumber (with peel), banana and kiwis into coins.
Add all ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve right away or pour into a bottle and take with you on the go.
Soak chia seeds for at least 20 minutes in 4 tablespoons of the almond milk. Set aside to gel. Soak cashews in water (and discard) for at least 20 minutes to soften.
In a high speed blender or food processor, combine all ingredients until smooth.
Adjust almond milk liquid to change consistency to your desired taste.
Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Give your 7 lemons a good scrub and zest the peels; set aside.

Add 1 cup of sugar to a medium saucepan, along with all your lemon zest. 1 cup of sugar will yield a mildly sweet lemonade. If you prefer sweeter lemonade, use 1-1/2 cups of sugar. Pour in 2 cups of water and bring the mixture to a simmer, until the sugar is dissolved.

Juice all 7 of your lemons into a serving pitcher, taking care to keep seeds out. Pour the lemon and sugar mixture into the pitcher (using the strainer again if you prefer no pulp) and stir. Then add the 6 cups of remaining water.
Serve poured over ice. Enjoy!
In a large pitcher, combine ros√©, vodka, lemonade, club soda, strawberries, and lemons. Stir and refrigerate until chilled and up to overnight.
For the simple syrup: Combine sugar and water in a small saucepot over medium-high heat. Bring to a simmer until the sugar dissolved. Remove from heat and cool completely.
Put the mint, lime juice, and Simple Syrup in a pitcher. Muddle for a few seconds to release the flavor from the mint.
Pour in the coconut water and rum. Add ice to fill a pitcher, and stir to combine and chill.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Juice all fruits and vegetables. Whisk together before drinking. Enjoy!
Juice lemon (with rind). Add ginger, to taste. Juice remaining ingredients in single or double auger juicer. Whisk in spirulina. Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Sweetener, herbal extract powder from Stevia leaf

instructions.name: Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Juice fruits and vegetables. Mix well before drinking. Enjoy!
Place the strawberries and two mint sprigs into a small bowl and mash up with a fork or potato masher. Add lime juice and honey and mix to combine.
Divide the mixture and ice cubes between two glasses and top with the sparkling water.
Decorate with remaining mint sprigs and serve.
Starting with the milk, toss all the ingredients into the blender with a handful of ice. Pulse until smooth, serve, and enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add ice if deisred.
Core tomatoes (just remove its top green part) and cut them into thin wedges. Chop onion, and celery.
Add tomatoes, chopped onion, chopped celery, bay leaf, sugar, paprika and salt in a pot.
Cook uncovered on low heat for around 25-30 minutes or until tomatoes become soft and mixture is juicy. Stir in between occasionally.
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve to get juice, discard the solids. Another option is to puree the mixture in a blender and strain through sieve.
Chill the mixture for 30 minutes before serving. Serve in chilled glasses and garnish with lemon wedges.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Blend all ingredients together except the chia.
Pour contents of blender into preferred drinking glass and stir in the chia.
Keep stirring the drink until the chia seeds have started expanding (about. 5 minutes).
Drink and enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender (excluding cherries) and pulse until smooth. Garnish with cherry and enjoy!
Peel and dice the mango and puree in the blender. Add the rest of the ingredients and puree until the ice is crushed and the drink is frothy. Serve in tall glasses with additional ice, if desired.
In a blender combine milk, frozen strawberries, 1/2 banana, chocolate milk powder, vanilla and sugar. Blend until smooth. If consistency is too runny, you may add more strawberries.
Combine undrained can of pineapples, yogurt, banana, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend while adding orange juice until fruit is pureed and it is the desired consistency.
Pure all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Optional: a pinch of salt adds a lot to the flavor.
Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-full of ice. Shake well. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a small lime wedge or curl of lime peel.
Combine all ingredients in the nutribullet; fill with water to the "Max" line. Mix until smooth. Enjoy!
Blend all ingredients together and serve!
*Original recipe calls for Diet Snapple Half & Half, but you can substitute any sort of juice, lemonade or tea but the nutritional value will change.
Combine ingredients into blender, and blend for at least 1 minute or until desired consistency.
Blend spinach and almond milk until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients, and blend until smooth.
Mix the chia seeds and almond milk in a bowl. Add the vanilla extract, and stir well to make sure that all seeds are soaked in the milk.
Put the bowl in the fridge and leave it to soak overnight or for a couple of hours. Stir before serving.
TIP: The amount of milk you put in depends on the consistency you wish for. The more milk you let the seeds soak in, the more fluid the pudding will be.

recipes.title: Ginger, Apple, and Mint Green Smoothie

instructions.name: Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add more water if necessary. Enjoy!
Remove kale leaves from their rough center stalk and coarsely chop. Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add ice if deisred. Thin with water if needed.

Place the milk, white chocolate, and salt in a medium saucepan. Whisk continuously over medium-low heat, until the chocolate has melted and the mixture is smooth (do not boil). Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Serve immediately with whipped cream and mashmallows, if desired. Enjoy!
Boil water. While boiling put tea packet in an empty mug.
Pour boiling water into mug with tea bag and let brew for 3 minutes.
Add sugar and milk as desired.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add water, as needed. Enjoy!
Blend kale and coconut water until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients, and blend until smooth. Enjoy!
Recipe adapted from: Simplegreensmoothies.com
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. If necessary, add milk/water. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine raspberries, milk and 1/2 cup ice in blender until smooth; set aside.
Combine mango, orange juice and 1/2 cup ice in blender until smooth; set aside.
Serve raspberry mixture immediately, topped with mango mixture. Enjoy!
Grind and brew coffee in french press or coffee machine. While coffee is brewing, place butter and coconut oil into coffee cup(s).

Pour coffee into cup(s) with butter and oil, and wait 1 minute for them to dissolve partially. Stir to mix butter and oil into coffee, wait 1 more minute or until fully dissolved. Serve immediately, stirring when necessary as oil and fat separate. Enjoy!
Soak the almonds overnight or for at least 4 hours (unless you‚Äôve got a Vitamix or other high powered blender, and then this step is optional).
Simply blend the ingredients together, starting with the avocado, greens and liquids to form a base, before putting everything else in ‚Äì except the chia.
Once it‚Äôs all blended, stir through the chia seeds and then wait for 2 minutes for the chia to thicken the liquid. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
In a glass, mash cherries and lime juice.
Add vodka and stir.
In a copper mug, pour cherry mixture over ice and top it off with ginger beer.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Pour into glass and set aside. Combine remaining 5 ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Pour into the same glass. Use a spoon or straw to swirl the mixture. Enjoy!
Mix all the ingredients, and let the mixture infuse overnight, drink it all the following day. Enjoy!
Pour milk into a small saucepan over medium heat and whisk in cocoa, sugar, chocolate chips, cinnamon, vanilla, and almond extract.
Continue cooking over medium heat, whisking almost constantly, until it just barely begins to lightly boil, about 10 minutes; remove from heat.
Transfer to a mug, top with any desired toppings, and serve. Enjoy!
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Brown chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Add tomatoes with green chile peppers, beans, and corn.
Reduce heat and let simmer for 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Add a dash of cumin and serve.
Recipe inspired by: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/15302/southwest-chicken/
Peel orange. Juice carrots and orange. Mix together well just before serving. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Banana, Coffee, Cashew, and Cocoa Smoothie

instructions.name: Brew coffee (or use instant).
Using smoothie or ice crush setting, pur√©e banana, dates, coffee, cashews, oats, cocoa powder, cardamom, salt, and ¬Ω cup ice in a blender until smooth.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Add more water if necessary. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Place cubed mangos, sugar, cream, and ice into a blender; puree until smooth.
Pour mixture into a large resealable plastic freezer bag. Seal, and freeze for 45 minutes to an hour. Move the contents around in the bag every 15 minutes while freezing.
Slice lemons for garnish.

Cut watermelon flesh into 2-inch chunks and discard rind. Pure one fourth of watermelon in a blender with 1 Tbsp sugar, 1 tsp lemon juice, 4 cups ice, and a pinch of salt. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl, discarding solids. Make 3 more batches. Add sugar to taste if desired and serve over ice. Garnish with lemon slices and mint sprigs.
In a blender pur√©e cucumbers and water. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve set over a large bowl, pressing on solids (you should have about 2 cups juice; refrigerate overnight, if desired).

In a pitcher, mash fresh mint leaves with back of a wooden spoon until bruised. Add cucumber juice, lime, club soda, and honey; stir to combine. Fill four glasses with ice, top with drink, and serve with thinly sliced cucumber.
Combine all ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in the Nutribullet; fill to the "Max Fill" line with water. Pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Add all ingredients to a blender, and blend until creamy and smooth. Add more almond milk to thin, or more frozen strawberries or ice to thicken.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more lime for acidity, banana for sweetness, or watermelon for a more intense watermelon flavor.
Top with additional chia seeds to mock watermelon seeds! Best when fresh, though leftovers keep covered in the refrigerator for 1-2 days.
PREPARATION: Freeze your pineapple and mango in a freezer bag until you‚Äôre ready to eat.
fruit with kale, spinach and coconut milk in a blender until desired consistency.
Starting with the milk, toss all the ingredients into the blender with a handful of ice. Pulse until smooth. Enjoy!
Blend the strawberries, mulberries, tea, and lemon juice together until smooth. Stop the blender, taste, and add desired sweetener, if needed.
Add the chia seeds, and give the blender a second quick whirl, just to mix the ingredients. (Incorporating the chia seeds at the end allows the smoothie to retain a smoother texture.)
Enjoy!

Add the cinnamon and turmeric while stirring. Let the juice simmer for 1-2 minutes.
You might want to strain the juice through a sieve if you are not a big fan of pulp. Let the juice cool off a bit, before using a sieve.

Blend all ingredients in a blender just until smooth with some small bits of date.

Place the mint water (including leaves) peaches, ice cream and 1 cup of ice cubes in a blender and puree until smooth. Serve immediately in chilled glasses and garnish with a slice of peach and a sprig of mint.

Add one bag of banana and blueberries to blender. Add the date, oats, almond milk and almond butter, and process until creamy and smooth. If the smoothie is too thick, add more almond milk.

instructions.name: In a micrrowave-safe cup or bowl mix together the milk, vanilla, nutmeg, sugar, and cinnamon.
Microwave on HIGH until the milk is very hot, removing once to stir, 1-2 minutes.
